lucien - (18/05/2009 10:25): Hi folks,  
lucien - (18/05/2009 10:25): someone knows for what reasons org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException can be thrown ?  
lucien - (18/05/2009 10:25): stack trace here : http://paste.debian.net/36453/plain/36453

sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 11:13): Hi lucien  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 11:13  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 11:13): Is that the entire exception, or is there something else?  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:14): Hi Sergiu  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 11:14): Because it is rather uniformative  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:15): I'm checking  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:17): This was missing : http://paste.debian.net/36459/plain/36459  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 11:18): Still no clue  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 11:18): When exactly does it occur?  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:18): When I save a document  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 11:19): Every time?  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 11:19): Every document?  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 11:21  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:21): not every time  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:22): and not every document  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:22): you can check http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/sandbox/xwiki-plugin-annotation/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/annotation/AnnotationPlugin.java  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:22): addA  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:23): addAnnotation method  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:23): maybe I did something wrong  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:27): for a given page first save seems always succeed.  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:28): but others fails  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:48): I hava a different stack trace : http://paste.debian.net/36462/plain/36462  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 11:49): This is either a concurrency problem, or bad usage of a transaction  
lucien - (18/05/2009 11:50): Does it means that I should lock the document I'm working on ?

arunreddy - (18/05/2009 15:25): sdumitriu : Hi  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 15:25): Hi arunreddy  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 15:26): need some help on running Groovy based Extensions  
asyd - (18/05/2009 15:28): don't ask to ask, just ask  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 15:28): asyd: to me ?  
asyd - (18/05/2009 15:28): yes  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 15:29): Ok, Am trying to implement this Media wiki extension -- http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extensions/MediaWiki2XWikiExtension  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 15:29): which is written on groovy..   
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 15:29): Dont even know whether its complete or not.  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 15:31): looking for some help on how to go with it.  
asyd - (18/05/2009 15:31): well, you should create a page, paste the contents   
asyd - (18/05/2009 15:31): your user must have programming rights on the page you create  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 15:35): ok  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 15:36): Don't forget to change the file path  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 15:37): Create a Page > Copy the code into the page with wiki editor. ?  
asyd - (18/05/2009 15:37): yup  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 15:37  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 15:38): asyd : All the code  is reproduced as text.   
asyd - (18/05/2009 15:38): (it's a just guess, by the way. But you should try)  
asyd - (18/05/2009 15:38): have you programming rights?  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 15:38): You must start with <% and end with %>  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 15:39): This is how Groovy code is marked  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 15:39  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 15:40): Oh..Thanks a lot.

sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 16:07): Hi alexmaru  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 16:07): How are you?  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 16:07): Didn't see you lately  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 16:09): Hi alexmaru.  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 16:18): hi

CristinaS - (18/05/2009 16:37): hi!  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 16:37): Hi CristinaS  
CristinaS - (18/05/2009 16:38): sorry I was very busy with the school and that's why I wasn't online recently  
CristinaS - (18/05/2009 16:38): I have a question  
CristinaS - (18/05/2009 16:39): .. it is not clear for me, if I use a xml-rpc client to store a new page, in which syntax should be the content of the page written?  
CristinaS - (18/05/2009 16:40): (sorry if it is a stupid question but is not clear for me)  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 16:41): Ideally, the syntax of the document  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 16:41): Which in XWiki can be configured for each document  
CristinaS - (18/05/2009 16:42): for my extension, can I work with html documents?  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 16:43): For the beginning, yes  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 16:43): But plan for using a wiki syntax in the future, when you design the architecture  
CristinaS - (18/05/2009 16:44): ok, thanks  
CristinaS - (18/05/2009 16:45): about maven , I've downloaded that plugin from cvs   
CristinaS - (18/05/2009 16:46): i've built finally the exemple class with it , but now I have to find out how can I make the oxt package  
CristinaS - (18/05/2009 16:46): to contain also the dialog files and the .xcu ones  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 16:49): sdumitriu : Finally succeeded in importing media wiki into xwiki  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 16:49): :)

alexmaru - (18/05/2009 19:27): I keep having a problem with gwt in  Platform - Web - WYSIWYG,  Exception attempting to run script - compile.sh, Embedded error: compile.sh script exited abnormally with code - 1... which apparently has something to do with running out of memory, but my  $MAVEN\_OPTS is -Xmx512m and [INFO] Final Memory: 114M/488M  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 19:27): any ideas?  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 19:29): Permgen?  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 19:29): MAVEN\_OPTS="-Xmx500m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m"  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 19:43): no luck  
tuska joined #xwiki at 19:45  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 19:48): alexmaru: OS? mvn -version? java -version?  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 19:49): ubuntu 8.1, mvn 2.1.0, java 1.6.0\_10  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 19:50): sdumitriu  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 19:51): even i face the same problem at times  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 19:51): with WYSIWYG  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 19:51): sdumitriu : what is Permgen ..?  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 19:52): arunreddy: how did u fixed this?  
arunreddy left at 19:52 (Remote closed the connection)  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 19:52): PermGen is the memory allocated for the classloader  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 19:52): It limits the number of classes that can be loaded  
vmassol left at 19:52 ()  
arunreddy joined #xwiki at 19:52  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 19:52): PermGen is the memory allocated for the classloader  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 19:52): It limits the number of classes that can be loaded  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 19:53): alexmaru: Try maven 2.0.10  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 19:53): ok  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 19:53): sdumitriu: let me try some things first  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 19:56): arunreddy: how did u fixed this problem?  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 19:57): which one?  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 19:57): WYSIWYG failure ?

arunreddy - (18/05/2009 19:57): yes

arunreddy - (18/05/2009 19:58): but at times it used to fail  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 19:58): now i have changed the Maven Opts  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 19:58): and trying to build it again  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 19:59): let's try with 2000 :P  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 20:04): 2000 ..?   
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 20:04): -Xmx2000m ?  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:04): yes  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:04): not working  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 20:04): or permsize ?  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:04): > -Xmx2000m  
fmancinelli joined #xwiki at 20:11  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 20:16  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:25): sdumitriu  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:25): I've switched to 2.0.9  
rrodriguez left at 20:26 ()  
florinciu left at 20:26 ("ChatZilla 0.9.84 [Firefox 3.0.10/2009042316]")  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:26): it passed the WYSIWYG module  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:26): :)

alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:31): finally  
Nano\_ joined #xwiki at 20:32  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 20:33): Hello all  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:33): hi Nano\_  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 20:33): nice someone =P  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:34): :)  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:34): what's going on?  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 20:34): Im french, im bad in english  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 20:34): prevent you  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:34): :)  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:35): are u a XWiki user?  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 20:35): I just look at the xwiki irc to have an idea of the community  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 20:35): President =)  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:36): sdumitriu: where sould I start this http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-3624 ?  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 20:36): I just start intranet in my society  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 20:36): with xwiki  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:37): cool :), I'm a google summer of code student for XWiki  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:38): well, I guess u can talk with vmassol, XWiki CTO  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 20:38): google summer code? what is?  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:39): it's a program that takes place in the summer, as a student u work on a project for an open source organisation and google pays u  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 20:39): http://code.google.com/soc/  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 20:40): Nice  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:42): Hi Nano\_  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 20:42): HI  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:43): There isn't much activity at this time of the day  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 20:43): what your opinion about xwiki?  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:44): I'm a developer, so I think it's great :)  
lucaa - (18/05/2009 20:44): alexmaru: re XWIKI-3624 well, look at the related issues...  
lucaa - (18/05/2009 20:44): look at xwiki.getPreference  
lucaa - (18/05/2009 20:44): see what everything is about  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 20:44): Yeah i thing is a great platform too  
lucaa - (18/05/2009 20:45): where these "preferences" stored, what will be affected by the name change  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 20:45): XWIKI-3468  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:45): alexmaru: The point is that we want to make settings public  
lucaa - (18/05/2009 20:45): (I hope that's what you were asking)  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:45): But not all settings are meant to be public  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:45): yup  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:45): got that  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:45): Like the superadmin password and encryption keys  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:45): where are these settings?  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:45): xwiki.cfg  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:45): WEB-INF/xwiki.cfg in the result  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:46): xwiki-tools/xwiki-configuration-resources/src/main/resources in the sources  
lucaa - (18/05/2009 20:46): but looking at the code of xwiki.getPreference() should reveal that, right?  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:46): Yes, if you go deep enough  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:47): So, the goal is to have a public getPreference method that only returns non-private settings  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:47): So a simple idea was to prefix all private settings with "system."  
lucaa - (18/05/2009 20:47): btw, gang, who coded the bot to display issues? it's really sexy  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:47): yup  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 20:48): sdumitriu..  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:49): okay  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 20:49  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:49): This means that you must:  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:49): 1. Determine which are the private settings  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:49): 2. See where they are used  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:49): 3. Modify the code that uses them to use the prefixed version  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:49): 4. Write a deprecation aspect that catches these calls and also tries the old values if the new setting does not exist  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:49): arunreddy: Yes?  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:50): thanks :)  
alexmaru - (18/05/2009 20:50): I'll look into this  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:50): lucaa: It is the result of the combined work or several developers, me being the last one  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 20:50): i answered lucaa.  
arunreddy - (18/05/2009 20:50): :)  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:51): arunreddy: Oh, OK  
lucaa - (18/05/2009 20:53): great job sdumitriu  
sdumitriu - (18/05/2009 20:53): Thanks  
alexmaru left at 21:01 ("ChatZilla 0.9.84 [Firefox 3.0.3/2008101315]")  
Nano\_ - (18/05/2009 21:24): See you later all  
tachirei joined #xwiki at 21:25
